data.title: Nobel Prize winner Orhan Pamuk and historian Nükhet Varlik probe depictions of plague in the Ottoman World
data.meta_description: Empty houses are filled with the smell of rotting flesh. The rich have run to their country homes. What’s that noise? People peek out of their windows into deserted streets as pandemonium builds. Rumor has it, the plague has come to town. These visceral images are at the forefront of the writing of Orhan Pamuk and Nükhet Varlik.
